intro: Atherosperma integrifolium, commonly known as the smooth-leaved atherosperma, is a flowering plant native to Tasmania. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and leathery, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, white or cream-colored flowers arranged in dense, spherical inflorescences. It is typically found in wet sclerophyll forests and is adapted to the cool, moist climate of its native habitat. The species is valued for its ornamental qualities and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
